stem: Varicose veins of the lower limb are most directly caused by which pathophysiologic change?

choices.B: Failure of venous valves in superficial veins
choices.E: Congenital absence of the femoral vein

rationale_correct: Varicose veins result from venous valve failure causing blood pooling and tortuous superficial veins.

rationale_distractors.A: Atherosclerosis affects arteries, not the superficial venous valves.
rationale_distractors.C: Varicosities are not due to venous rupture.
rationale_distractors.D: Decreased, not increased, pump function contributes to venous stasis.
rationale_distractors.E: Femoral vein absence is not a typical cause of varicosities.
